etymology.description: 澤(泽) (zé, "marsh") refers to a wetland or swampy area which nourishes and supports life. 東(东) (dōng, "east") indicates the direction of the sunrise, associated with beginnings.
etymology.interpretation: The word 泽东(澤東) (Zédōng) combines the concept of a life-nurturing marshland with the direction east. Symbolically, it can represent the idea of a fertile and sustaining area to the east. The name is famously associated with Mao Zedong, the former leader of China.
etymology.simplification: 泽 is the simplified form of 澤, and 东 is the simplified form of 東.

examples.chinese: 毛泽东(毛澤東)领导革命(領導革命)，创建新中国(創建新中國)。
examples.pinyin: Máo Zédōng lǐngdǎo gémìng, chuàngjiàn xīn Zhōngguó.
examples.english: Mao Zedong led the revolution and founded the new China.

examples.chinese: 泽东(澤東)原指东边的沼泽(原指東邊的沼澤)，后来成为名字(後來成為名字)。
examples.pinyin: Zédōng yuán zhǐ dōngbiān de zhǎozé, hòulái chéngwéi míngzì.
examples.english: Zedong originally referred to an eastern marsh and later became a name.
